content.description: Triple corners (crux) to beautiful long crack
content.protection: Bring the smallest gear you have for the bottom corners- standard rack for the rest 2 pin/nut anchor at top

content.description: Start by climbing the left facing corner of Ooh Mow Mao up to a few hand jams before gaining the ledge.  From the ledge, split right and enter the right facing dihedral, making some fun technical moves before gaining the crack above.
content.protection: Small gear for the dihedral (RPs, critical .2), single rack to 3" should get you up
content.location: Left edge of the sunkist wall, 20 feet left of autobot

content.description: Overlap funkiness to a beautiful long crack
content.protection: Standard Rack- pin and nut anchor on top

content.description: Sunny and secluded crag situated high above the Kanc with a great concentration of crack climbs on the Sunkist wall. Many climbs here start off with tricky moves through overlaps, but finish up long moderate cracks which you cant see from the ground. Posting this here because it could use some love, but much more thorough descriptions are in the guidebook! I'd bring a 70m to climb here
